result.execSummary:
The defendant Douglas R McFaul was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber with standard release conditions.  Sentence credit for 1 day granted if revoked.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

miscConds.notes: Fine to be paid as a condition of probation.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha Police Department to be paid as a condition of probation.

Perform Alcohol Assessment.  Attendance at the Victim Impact Panel meeting on either August 19, 2015 or the following one, or 30 days jail consecutive.
No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

DNA Surcharge waived.
DNA Sample waived.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours with standard release conditions - To commence July 23, 2015 by 3:00 p.m.

records.addlTxt: Prescription Profile
from Serenity Inns
(3) character letters
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

Defendant Douglas R McFaul in court with attorney James E Goldmann.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Konrad Paczuski, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Recommendations by the State.  Arguments by the Defense.  Statement by the Defendant.

Court orders the following: 
- 6 months Huber with standard release conditions. STAYED.  Credit for 1 day if revoked.
- 1 yearsProbation
- 15 months Drivers License Revocation. 
- 15 months Ignition Interlock on any vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant 
- Alcohol Assessment
- Attendance at the Victim Impact Panel meeting on either August 19, 2015 or the following one, or 30 days jail consecutive.
- Fine of $1,179.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Blood Test Reimbursement of $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Waukesha Police Department
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived
- Conditions of Probation:  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school.
CONDITION TIME: 7 days - NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence July 23, 2015 by 3:00 pm.

Count 1 dismissed and read in.  Defense requests adjourned sentencing date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Douglas R McFaul in court with attorney James E Goldmann.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Christine Bohn, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense states he mailed a motion to suppress and authorization to the court on 4/7/13.  State has received the documents but the court has not.  Defense requests motion hearing be set and he will ensure the court receives a copy.  Motion hearing expected to last 30 minutes.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.

Defendant Douglas R McFaul in court.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is still seeking counsel and trying to raise funds.  Court addresses WCS letter.  Hearing scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on February 27, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program

Defendant Douglas R McFaul in court.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 09:00 am.
